html.p: The project has a single mailing list, which can be used for sending bug reports, patches, suggestions, questions, etc.

Note: You cannot post without subscribing, due to the large amount of spam we were getting, but you can subscribe and then disable mail delivery if you prefer to read the list via one of the web interfaces below rather than by getting emails.

ul.li: Read via web interface: gmane, SourceForce

html.p: If clicking on the news: link above directly doesn't work:

ol.li: Load Pan (or some other news-reader) and add news.gmane.org as a new server (Tools->News Servers).
Select gmane using the Server menu.
Type zero-install into the group search box (top left) and press Return to find the group.

You can right click over the group and choose Subscribe from the menu to make it easier to find them in future. Note that 'Subscribing' to a news group just marks it as interesting to your news-reader. It is different to subscribing to get emails.

html.p: Bugs can also be filed on the bug tracker. However, it's best to post non-trivial bugs to the mailing list too, as more people will see them there.

Please do not contact me by email directly. This prevents other people from seeing the question and its answer (on the lists or the searchable archives), and means I have to answer the same questions over and over again. It's also more likely that you'll get a reply if more people see your question. Messages sent directly to me will most likely either be ignored or bounced to the mailing list anyway.
The only exceptions to this are reports of security problems and requests for interviews, which may be sent by email.

If you require commercial support, please ask on the mailing list (see above). Remember to say what kind of support you need: do you need a new feature implemented, or help making your existing application available?
